home. writings. contact.
Hi!
I'm Abiram,
a coder who
loves ramen.

I'm a first year student at UNSW Sydney, studying computer science and electrical engineering.

I created this site to serve as a portfolio of some of the cool stuff I've done, and also so that I can publish some of the random thoughts I want to share with the world.

recent projects.

CSESoc Website
April 2020 -
In my first major team project, I had the opportunity to improve my front and backend web development skills while fostering a DevOps culture.
UNSW SecSoc
April 2020 -
I explored my interests in security while on SecSoc's committee, writing Capture the Flag (CTF) challenges.
cr4sh-0verr1de
June 2020 - August 2020
I participated in a team of five in hackathons ran by CSESoc to rapidly develop applications in a 24 hour period.

You can see more of what I'm working on here.

foreseeably asked questions.

Q: What OS do you use?
Windows. While I have some gripes about it, WSL is what's keeping me from fully moving to Linux. I might write something about that in the near future. :0

Q: How long have you been programming for?
I started messing around with processing.js on Khan Academy in 2012, and I've played around with code and learned more for fun ever since.

Q: What's with you and ramen?
Ramen (whether it be real or instant) is an amazing food and abiramen just stuck as a username which I use in a lot of places. At that point, I decided that basing my entire personality on a bowl of food was a good idea. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

Q: Are you aware that your ramen bowl looks a bit like a face?
Uhhh... It's a feature, not a bug. :)

Q: Why does this FAQ even exist? I bet no one's asking half of these.
Don't expose my filler content like that. :(

Made with ❤ and ramen by Abiram
